description.narrative: At the end of the project period, 300 000 rice farmers in the Mekong Delta and Soc Trang and An Giang provinces in particular are reached. After the project ends, the service will be scaled-up further, to reach around 12 million rice farmers in the Mekong Delta and beyond.

G4AW: http://g4aw.spaceoffice.nl/en/ NSO: http://www.spaceoffice.nl/en/
Sat4Rice (Satellite data for rice farmers/production) aims to improve the effectiveness of existing extension services and output of (smallholder) rice farmers in the Mekong Delta. This will be done by enriching the existing basic agricultural information with advanced geodata. It will help raise awareness, provide knowledge and build resilience of local communities. The efficiency of inputs for rice production in the Mekong Delta, e.g. water, fertiliser and pesticides, will also be improved.

Improve the effectiveness of existing extension services and output of (smallholder) rice farmers in the Mekong Delta by enriching the existing basic agricultural news service Agri.One with advanced geodata.
Information services for rice farmers in Vietnam

Sat4Rice will implement a financially sustainable information service, hosted by Loc Troi (LT) Group, with support from public private Dutch and Vietnamese partners. After the project the service can easily be implemented to other regions/countries and for other types of agriculture.

This project will significantly improve the information that LT Group distributes to rice farmers. Integration of satellite data with local measurements and use of advanced geoprocessing techniques will provide high quality information.
The information services will cover: • Crop management advisory (e.g. choice of varieties, rotation, timing and quantity of fertilizer use) • Pests and diseases advisory (e.g. observed and predicted spread) • Drought and salinity advisory (e.g. timing of water use, irrigation frequency and quantity) • Flood mitigation advisory (e.g. risks and potential damage reduction)
After the project, the operational service is hosted by LT Group with support from Dutch and Vietnamese partners. If successful in these two provinces, the Sat4Rice partnership intends to scale-up in the entire Mekong Delta and the rest of Vietnam. In addition to rice farming, the partnership will explore broadening of the services to other types of agricultural services like coffee.

Vietnam is one of the most disaster-prone countries in the world and among the countries that are hit the hardest by climate change. The Mekong Delta region is a vulnerable region, but also one of the largest rice producing regions in the World. The An Giang and Soc Trang provinces are two of the most important rice producing provinces.

Sustainability and impact of the programme

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program

title.narrative: Performed impact study: Assesment of the sustainability and impact of the program

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program. Indicators will include: • Poverty reduction • Increased food security • Increased income security • Improved input efficiency • Sustainable water use • Increased resilience • Climate change adaptation • Gender equality • Sustainable development stakeholders • Sustainable economic growth
Number of food producers (#) with an improvement (%) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.
Improvement (%) in food production as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

comment.narrative: Most projects and corresponding partnerships were formed within this program, having no previous results. Furthermore, most projects need an initial technical development and gained support and commitment of involved stakeholders before any real results can be reached. As a result, most projects do not start to achieve significant results until the third year of operation.
End of programme goal: average >10% increase among all individual projects
